gw.api.webservice.maintenanceTools

Interface MaintenanceToolsBase

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    ICCMaintenanceToolsAPI
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    CCMaintenanceToolsImpl, MaintenanceToolsImpl

    public interface MaintenanceToolsBase
    The base interface to methods used for managing the application. This is distinct from ISystemToolsAPI which is concerned with managing the application platform. There is an application specific interface derived from this, such as ICCMaintenanceTools and IPCMaintenanceTools.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static java.lang.String API_NAME
      The trailing portion of the URI that is the end point for the service.

    • Field Detail

      • API_NAME

        static final java.lang.String API_NAME
        The trailing portion of the URI that is the end point for the service. For this service the value is "maintenance".
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • startBatchProcess

        ProcessID startBatchProcess(java.lang.String processName)
        Starts the given batch process. If the process is already running on the server, an exception will be thrown.
        Parameters:
        processName - the name of the batch process to start
        Returns:
        the ProcessID of the process that was started

      • requestTerminationOfBatchProcess

        boolean requestTerminationOfBatchProcess(java.lang.String processName)
        Terminates the given batch process, if it's running.
        Parameters:
        processName - the name of the batch process to terminate
        Returns:
        true if the process was terminated, false if it wasn't running or couldn't be terminated

      • requestTerminationOfBatchProcess

        boolean requestTerminationOfBatchProcess(ProcessID pid)
        Terminates the given batch process, if it's currently running. Note that it's possible that this particular invocation could have finished and another invocation of the same process begun, in which case this won't terminate the current invocation.
        Parameters:
        pid - the process ID of the process to terminate
        Returns:
        true if the process was terminated, false if it wasn't running or couldn't be terminated

      • batchProcessStatusByName

        ProcessStatus batchProcessStatusByName(java.lang.String processName)
        Gets the status of the given batch process, indicating whether or not the process is running and, if so, its current progress.
        Parameters:
        processName - the name of the process to retrieve the status of
        Returns:
        the status of that particular process

      • batchProcessStatusByID

        ProcessStatus batchProcessStatusByID(ProcessID pid)
        Gets the status of a particular batch process invocation. If that invocation is still running, the status will indicate as much, and only the startDate and opsCompleted fields will be filled in. Otherwise the returned object will contain information about the completed run (see ProcessStatus for information about all the fields returned).
        Parameters:
        pid - the process ID to retrieve the status of
        Returns:
        the status of that particular process invocation

      • getWorkQueueConfig

        WorkQueueConfig getWorkQueueConfig(java.lang.String queueName)
        Get the current configuration of distributed workers for the specified work queue.
        Parameters:
        queueName - Name of the queue to query
        Returns:
        A WorkQueueConfig instance containing the current settings

      • setWorkQueueConfig

        void setWorkQueueConfig(java.lang.String queueName,
                        WorkQueueConfig config)
        Sets the configuration for distributed workers for the specified work queue. Any currently running worker instances will be stopped after the current workitem in process is completed. New worker instances as specified by the passed in config will be created and started. Note that the changes made here are temporary; if the server is restarted, the initial values from config.xml will be used when creating and starting workers. Note that WorkQueueConfig object must have all fields set. The recommended approach is to call getWorkQueueConfig(String) to get the current configuration, modify the retrieved object, and pass it to setWorkQueueConfig(String, WorkQueueConfig).
        Parameters:
        queueName - Name of the queue to modify
        config - The configuration to establish. Note that all fields must be on set this object before calling this method!

      • getWorkQueueNames

        java.lang.String[] getWorkQueueNames()
        Returns the list of work queue names for this product. These names may be used in getWorkQueueConfig(java.lang.String) and setWorkQueueConfig(java.lang.String, gw.api.webservice.maintenanceTools.WorkQueueConfig).
        Returns:
        the array of work queue names

                   throws SOAPServerException,

      • notifyQueueWorkers

        void notifyQueueWorkers(java.lang.String queueName)
        Wakes up all workers for the specified queue across the cluster. Workers will check for workitems and will continue processing any found until the workitem table for the queue is empty.
        Parameters:
        queueName - Name of the queue to notify workers

      • getWQueueStatus

        WQueueStatus getWQueueStatus(java.lang.String queueName)
        Retrieves the status of active executors for that particular queue. Each executor contains information about last 25 workers ran by each executor.
        Parameters:
        queueName - name of the queue
        Returns:
        The status of the queue

      • getWorkQueueStatus

        WorkQueueStatus getWorkQueueStatus(java.lang.String queueName)
        Deprecated. use the method getWQueueStatus(String) instead. It returns more detailed and accurate information about a worker queue executors and workers.
        Retrieves the worker status and details for the last 25 workers to run for that particular queue.
        Parameters:
        queueName - name of the queue
        Returns:
        The status of the queue

      • waitOnActiveWorkItems

        boolean waitOnActiveWorkItems(java.lang.String queueName,
                              int maxWaitSecs,
                              long sleepMillis)
        This method will wait for a specific number of seconds
        Parameters:
        queueName - the name of the queue
        maxWaitSecs - the number of seconds to wait maximum, this must be balance by how long the request timeout is
        sleepMillis - the number of milliseconds to sleep each time there are still active work items
        Returns:
        true if the queue was empty

      • isPluginStarted

        boolean isPluginStarted(java.lang.String pluginName)
                 throws PermissionException
        whether the named startable plugin is started.
        Parameters:
        pluginName - the name of the plugin to check
        Returns:
        true if the plugin is started, false otherwise
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if invalid plugin name
        PermissionException - if no toolspluginview

      • startPlugin

        void startPlugin(java.lang.String pluginName)
          throws PermissionException
        Starts the given startable plugin. Requires toolsPluginedit
        Parameters:
        pluginName - the name of the plugin to start
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if invalid plugin name
        PermissionException - if no toolspluginedit

      • startPlugin

        void startPlugin(java.lang.String pluginName,
                 long timeout)
          throws PermissionException
        Starts the given startable plugin. Requires toolsPluginedit Blocks for up to timeout milliseconds to confirm plugin reached StartablePluginState.Started state
        Parameters:
        pluginName - the name of the plugin to start
        timeout - number of milliseconds to wait for a confirmed start
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if invalid plugin name
        PermissionException - if no toolspluginedit

      • stopPlugin

        void stopPlugin(java.lang.String pluginName)
         throws PermissionException
        Stop the given startable plugin, if it's started. Requires toolsPluginedit
        Parameters:
        pluginName - the name of the plugin
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if invalid plugin name
        PermissionException - if no toolspluginedit

      • stopPlugin

        void stopPlugin(java.lang.String pluginName,
                long timeout)
         throws PermissionException
        Stop the given startable plugin, if it's started. Requires toolsPluginedit Blocks for up to timeout milliseconds to confirm plugin reached StartablePluginState.Stopped state
        Parameters:
        pluginName - the name of the plugin
        timeout - number of milliseconds to wait for a confirmed stop
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if invalid plugin name
        PermissionException - if no toolspluginedit

      • changeSubtype

        void changeSubtype(java.lang.String publicID,
                   java.lang.String targetSubtype)
            throws PermissionException
        Change the contact with publicID from current subtype to targetSubtype
        Parameters:
        publicID - the publicID of the contact
        targetSubtype - the type you want to change contact subtype to
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if either contact can't be found or invalid type provided
        PermissionException - if no toolspluginedit
